title: Privacy Policy
introduction: Unicamp is committed to protecting your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and protect your information in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable laws.

whoWeAre.content:
Website Name: Unicamp
Website Address: www.unicamp.lt
Contact Email: info@unicamp.lt
Data Controller: UAB Unicamp 
If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or your rights under GDPR, please contact us at info@unicamp.lt.

informationWeCollect.content:
We may collect the following types of personal data:

a. Information You Provide to Us
- Name, email address, phone number, and mailing address (e.g., when you fill out forms, make purchases, or subscribe to newsletters).

b. Information Automatically Collected
- When you use our website, we may collect:
  - Cookies and Tracking Data: Information about your browsing behavior (e.g., pages visited, time spent).
  - Device Information: IP address, browser type, operating system, and device type.

c. Third-Party Sources
- We may receive data from:
  - Advertising networks
  - Analytics providers (e.g., Google Analytics)
  - Social media platforms

howWeUseYourInformation.content:
We use your information to:
- Provide and improve our services.
- Process payments and fulfill orders.
- Communicate with you about updates, promotions, or customer service issues.
- Personalize your experience on our website.
- Comply with legal obligations.

legalBasisForProcessing.content:
We process your personal data based on the following lawful grounds:
- Consent: When you opt-in (e.g., subscribing to emails, accepting cookies).
- Contractual Necessity: To fulfill a contract (e.g., processing payments).
- Legal Obligations: For compliance with applicable laws (e.g., tax regulations).
- Legitimate Interests: To improve our website and services.

cookies.content:
We use cookies to enhance your experience.

a. Types of Cookies We Use
- Necessary Cookies: Enable website functionality.
- Preference Cookies: Remember settings like language and location.
- Analytics Cookies: Track website usage for improvement.
- Marketing Cookies: Deliver tailored ads.

b. Consent for Cookies
- Non-essential cookies will only be activated after obtaining your explicit consent through a cookie banner. 

c. Third-Party Services
- We use third-party services (e.g., Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel) that may set their own cookies. For more information, visit their privacy policies.

dataSharing.content:
We may share your information with:
- Service Providers: For payment processing, analytics, hosting, and customer support.
- Advertising Partners: To deliver personalized ads.
- Legal Authorities: When required by law or to protect our legal rights.

International Transfers:
- If data is transferred outside the European Economic Area (EEA), we ensure adequate safeguards, such as:
  - EU-approved Standard Contractual Clauses.
  - Data transfer agreements.

dataProtection.content:
We use industry-standard security measures, such as:
- SSL encryption for data transmission.
- Firewalls and access controls to secure servers.
- Regular monitoring for potential vulnerabilities.

dataRetention.content:
We keep your data only as long as necessary for the purposes outlined in this policy or as required by law. For example:
- Order Data: Retained for 7 years for tax compliance.
- Marketing Data: Retained until you withdraw consent.

useOfAnalyticsTools.content:
To enhance our website's functionality and improve user experience, we use PostHog, an analytics platform. PostHog helps us understand how visitors interact with our website so we can make informed decisions about improvements.

What Data Does PostHog Collect?
PostHog collects anonymized data, including:
- Information about the pages you visit and the actions you take (e.g., button clicks, navigation patterns).
- Your device type, browser type, and general geographic location (e.g., country or region).

How Do We Use This Data?
We use this data to:
- Analyze and improve the usability and functionality of our website.
- Identify and resolve technical issues.

Data Protection Measures
All data collected by PostHog is anonymized and does not include personal identifiers like your name, email, or IP address.
Data collected is used exclusively for analytics purposes and is not shared with any third parties.

If you have any questions about our use of analytics tools, you can contact us at info@unicamp.lt.

yourRights.content:
Under the GDPR, you have the following rights:
- Access: Request a copy of your personal data.
- Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data.
- Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten"): Request deletion of your data.
- Restriction: Limit how your data is processed.
- Data Portability: Receive your data in a machine-readable format.
- Objection: Opt-out of specific processing activities, such as direct marketing.
- Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent at any time, where applicable.

To exercise these rights, contact us at info@unicamp.lt.

childrenPrivacy.content: Our website is not intended for children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you believe we have inadvertently collected such data, please contact us, and we will delete it promptly.

policyChanges.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page, with an updated revision date. Please review periodically for updates.
